text: The name Mia is a female name taken from the Slavic terminology mila (which represents "darling"). The moniker "Mia" comes from the Italian language and has its roots in the term "mio," which translates to "mine" or "my." It's common in Italian culture to use "Mia" as a pet name, akin to the English terms "honey" or "sweetheart." This usage imbues the name with a sense of warmth and affection, making it an ideal option for parents seeking a name that expresses love and tenderness towards their child. The name is strongly prevalent throughout Europe, the United States, England and Germany; in central Europe, Mia is a pet name version for Maria, Amelia and Emilia. This name was ranked #8 on the US Popular Names in 2021. There are many celebrities with the name, including Mia Hamm, Mia Rose and Mia Farrow. == People == * Mia Wasikowska, Australian actress * Mia Malkova, American media personality and longtime pornographic actress * Mia Sara, American actress ==References== Category:Given names
title: Mia (given name)
